item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 中国公司因俄罗斯战争而被列入新的制裁名单。亚洲股市将因美联储消息而上涨。Telegram 质疑首席执行官被捕。以下是您今天需要了解的信息。【原文：Chinese companies are added to fresh sanctions list over Russia’s war. Asia stocks set to rise on Fed news. Telegram questions arrest of CEO. Here’s what you need to know today.】

item.title: 鲍威尔确认下月降息后，黄金保持在历史记录附近
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔确认央行将于下月开始降息的预期后，黄金在纪录高点附近企稳。【原文：Gold steadied near a record high after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell affirmed expectations the central bank will start cutting interest rates next month.】

item.title: 锂价格暴跌后皮尔巴拉矿业公司利润骤降
item.description: 澳大利亚皮尔巴拉矿业有限公司（Pilbara Minerals Ltd.）表示，由于锂价格大幅下跌，该公司全年利润下滑。【原文：Australia’s Pilbara Minerals Ltd. said full-year profit slumped after a sharp drop in lithium prices.】

item.title: 受政策前景影响，新加坡元交投于十年高位附近
item.description: 新加坡元升至近十年来最强，因为交易员们权衡了当地货币当局相对鹰派的政策前景与美联储政策前景之间的差异。【原文：Singapore’s dollar advanced to its strongest in almost a decade as traders weighed the difference between the local monetary authority’s relatively hawkish policy outlook compared with that of the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 亚洲股市关注鲍威尔讲话后的美联储反弹：市场综述
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）发出美国将从下月起降息的信号令华尔街欢欣鼓舞之后，大多数亚洲股市周一早盘有望上涨。【原文：Most Asian stocks look poised to gain early Monday, after Wall Street was cheered by signals from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell that US interest rates will be cut from next month.】

item.title: 石油波动性昙花一现，75 美元仍是下限
item.description: 石油价格在 8 月初的大幅波动很快被逆转，每桶 75 美元的价格水平再次成为布伦特市场的症结所在。【原文：Oil’s early-August pop in volatility has been quickly reversed, with the $75-a-barrel price level once again proving to be a sticking point for the Brent market.】

item.title: 以色列打击黎巴嫩令中东局势紧张，石油价格上涨
item.description: 以色列对黎巴嫩南部的真主党目标发动先发制人的打击后，中东冲突升级，石油价格上涨。【原文：Oil advanced as the Middle East braced for escalating conflict after Israel launched a pre-emptive strike on Hezbollah targets in southern Lebanon.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 北美钢铁业正在亚特兰大聚会，该行业正努力应对美国需求不振、价格下滑和中国钢材过剩等问题。一份重要的巴西糖业报告将为即将到来的甜味剂价格走势提供启示。美国一个重要枢纽的原油库存也创下了 2 月份以来的最低水平。【原文：North America’s steel industry is gathering in Atlanta as the sector grapples with uninspired US demand, slumping prices and an overabundance of Chinese steel. A key Brazilian sugar report will offer insights on upcoming price moves for the sweetener. And crude oil stockpiles at a key US hub are at their lowest levels since February.】

item.title: 中国电动汽车制造商对欧盟不温不火的回应在关税争端中代价高昂
item.description: 上汽集团受到欧盟谈判代表的苛刻对待，正成为中国企业在西方商业和政治领域运作能力不足的警示故事。【原文：SAIC Motor Corp.’s harsh treatment by European Union negotiators is becoming a cautionary tale of Chinese companies being ill-equipped to operate in Western business and political domains.】

item.title: 亚洲表现最好的债券显示澳大利亚央行正在向虚空呐喊
item.description: 澳大利亚债券的无情反弹暴露了交易员们是多么不相信当地央行会顶住同行的压力，坚持其鹰派基调。【原文：A relentless rally in Australian bonds has laid bare how little traders believe that the local central bank will defy peer pressure to stand firm with its hawkish tone.】

item.description:
此外，一家建筑公司的财务总监还谈到了重新定位等问题。【原文：

Plus, a construction firm’s finance chief talks about reshoring and more.

item.title: 野火肆虐，巴西当局启动纵火调查
item.description: 巴西环境部长玛丽娜-席尔瓦（Marina Silva）表示，在巴西各地燃烧的野火是由低湿度和热浪以及犯罪活动引起的。【原文：Wildfires burning across Brazil have been caused by low humidity and a heat wave, but also by criminal activity, according to Environment Minister Marina Silva.】

item.title: 波兰拨款 12 亿美元启动首座核电站
item.description: 波兰计划在 2025 年的预算中拨出 46 亿兹罗提（约合 12 亿美元），用于开始筹建该国第一座核电站。【原文：Poland plans to earmark 4.6 billion zloty ($1.2 billion) in the 2025 budget to begin preparations for building the nation’s first nuclear power plant.】

item.title: 美国国家航空航天局（NASA）为太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）抛弃 "星际客机 "后，波音公司新任首席执行官面临艰难抉择
item.description: 在太空雄心遭遇耻辱性挫折后，波音公司面临着国家责任与现金储备紧张的两难境地。【原文：After a humiliating setback to its space ambitions, Boeing Co. faces a dilemma that pits its national duty against strained cash reserves.】

item.title: 加拿大腾出公共土地解决住房短缺问题
item.description: 贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）总理的政府确定了 56 处联邦房产，相当于约 2000 个冰球场大小，可在这些地方新建数百套经济适用房，以应对可用土地稀缺导致住房短缺加剧的问题。【原文：Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government identified 56 federal properties, representing the size of about 2,000 hockey rinks, where hundreds of new affordable homes could be built to counter the scarcity of available land worsening a housing shortage.】

item.title: 鲍威尔的举措让交易员对降息的幅度和路径产生争议
item.description: 既然美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔已明确表示下个月将降息，债券交易员们正集中押注首次降息的规模和未来的宽松路径。【原文：Now that Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has made it crystal clear that interest-rate cuts are coming next month, bond traders are focusing in on bets over the size of that first reduction and the future path of easing.】

item.title: 科威特在内阁改组中更换财政大臣
item.description: 科威特统治者周日签署了一项改组海湾国家内阁的法令，此举包括罢免财政部长和改变其他三个部长职位。【原文：Kuwait’s ruler signed a decree to reshuffle the Gulf nation’s cabinet on Sunday, a move that included ousting the finance chief and changing three other portfolios.】

item.title: 美联储官员准备降息之际，鲍威尔点赞即将到来的战略审查
item.description: 在本周末的杰克逊霍尔会议上，美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔概述了未来几个月的两个优先事项：保持美国经济的稳定，同时仔细研究过去几年中的问题所在。【原文：In Jackson Hole this weekend, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell outlined two priorities for the months ahead: keeping the US economy afloat while also taking a closer look at what went wrong over the past few years.】

item.title: 人民币套利交易在日元版崩溃后仍能兴旺发达
item.description: 本月，随着日本货币的飙升，大受欢迎的日元套利交易一蹶不振。一种不太知名的策略可能更能抵御此类冲击。【原文：The hugely popular yen carry trade crashed and burned this month as Japan’s currency surged. A less well-known version of the strategy is likely to be more immune to those kind of shocks.】

item.title: 沙特香水制造商希望在首次公开募股中筹集高达 1.88 亿美元的资金
item.description: 总部位于沙特阿拉伯的香水生产商 Al Majed for Oud Company 计划在沙特主要证券交易所进行首次公开募股，募集高达 1.88 亿美元的资金。【原文：Saudi Arabia-based perfume maker Al Majed for Oud Company plans to raise up to $188 million in an initial public offering on the kingdom’s main stock exchange.】

item.title: 中石化净利润增长，上游优势抵消炼油影响
item.description: 中国最大的炼油企业中石化上半年利润略有增长，原因是上游业务表现较好，抵消了炼油和石化业务的疲软。【原文：Sinopec, China’s top oil refiner, reported a marginal increase in first-half profit as a better performance from its upstream operations offset weakness in refining and petrochemicals.】

item.title: 土耳其顶级银行家认为降息周期将从 11 月开始
item.description: 土耳其最大的私营部门贷款机构首席执行官表示，土耳其央行很可能在今年晚些时候开始一轮降息周期，到 2025 年底，借贷成本可能会降低一半。【原文：Turkey’s central bank is likely to begin a cycle of interest rate cuts later this year with the cost of borrowing potentially being halved by the end of 2025, according to the chief executive of the country’s largest private-sector lender.】

item.title: 沙特电信公司提高股息后创下 2014 年以来最大涨幅
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯顶级电信公司宣布计划提高季度股息，并表示可能考虑通过特别支付向投资者发放更多资金，此后该公司股价创下近十年来最大涨幅。【原文：Shares in Saudi Arabia’s top telecom company rose the most in almost a decade after the company announced plans to boost quarterly dividends and said it may consider handing over more money to investors via special payments.】

item.title: 澳大利亚养老基金将收购国家电力公司股份：澳大利亚电力公司
item.description: 据《澳大利亚金融评论报》（Australian Financial Review）报道，澳大利亚第二大养老基金--澳大利亚退休信托基金（Australian Retirement Trust）同意收购新西兰能源分销商 Powerco Ltd. 的多数股权，但未说明从何处获得该消息。【原文：Australian Retirement Trust, the nation’s second-largest pension fund, agreed take majority ownership of New Zealand energy distributor Powerco Ltd., the Australian Financial Review reported, without saying where it got the information.】

item.title: 印度修改政府工作人员养老金制度，保证支付额度
item.description: 印度将实施一项养老金制度，保证联邦政府工作人员在退休后可以领取一定比例的基本工资。【原文：India will implement a pension system that guarantees federal government staff a percentage of their base salary as payout post their retirement.】

item.title: 埃德加-布朗夫曼的派拉蒙计划包括与大型科技公司合作
item.description: 据熟悉小埃德加-布朗夫曼想法的人士透露，他为派拉蒙全球公司制定的计划包括与亚马逊公司或苹果公司这样的科技巨头合作，以改善其流媒体电视业务。【原文：Edgar Bronfman Jr.’s plans for Paramount Global include partnering with a technology stalwart like Amazon.com Inc. or Apple Inc. to improve its streaming-TV business, according to people familiar with his thinking.】

item.title: 加拿大劳工委员会命令铁路员工返回工作岗位
item.description: 加拿大的一个独立仲裁庭已命令该国最大的两条铁路的工人重返工作岗位，并进行有约束力的仲裁，以解决这场导致北美供应链瘫痪的纠纷。【原文：An independent tribunal in Canada has ordered workers at the country’s two largest railways to get back on the job and to engage in binding arbitration to resolve a dispute that has snarled North American supply chains.】

item.title: 欧盟警告：红海油轮焚烧可能造成生态灾难
item.description: 欧盟驻该地区的海军部队周六表示，一艘运载原油的船只在红海遭到袭击后起火，可能导致严重的生态灾难。【原文：A ship carrying crude oil that caught fire after being attacked in the Red Sea could lead to a severe ecological disaster, the European Union’s naval force in the region said Saturday.】

item.title: 巴西圣保罗州野火数量创历史新高
item.description: 圣保罗州是拉丁美洲最大经济体中最富裕的地区，但由于湿度低、热浪袭人，这里的火灾数量创下了历史新高。【原文：The state of Sao Paulo, the wealthiest region of the largest economy in Latin America, is facing a record number of fires due to low humidity and a blistering heat wave.】

item.title: 美联储的首选价格指标将强化降息：生态周报
item.description: 下周的美国通胀数据将加强人们对期待已久的降息即将到来的信心，而消费者支出的读数将表明央行成功地保持了经济扩张的态势。【原文：US inflation figures in the coming week will reinforce that long-awaited interest-rate cuts are coming soon, while a reading on consumer spending is seen indicating that the central bank has been successful at keeping the expansion intact.】
